title: 2 Easy Ways to Crop an Image or Object in Inkscape

steps.title: Open Inkscape.
steps.content: Open Inkscape. This vector program is available on Windows, Mac, and Linux. If you don't have Inkscape, you can download it on the official website . [1] X Research source Clipping an object refers to cutting out an object from the background. If you're trying to crop in a more freeform shape, see the Clipping a Path section instead.

steps.title: Open an image.
steps.content: Open an image. You can use the keyboard shortcut CTRL + I (Windows) or CMD + I (Mac) to import an image. You can also click File > Import .

steps.title: Draw a shape over the image.
steps.content: Draw a shape over the image. Click the Square, Circle, or another shaped tool in the toolbar. Click and drag your cursor to create a shape over the image. This should be the part you want to keep. Make sure the shape is on top of your image.

steps.title: Click the Select tool.
steps.content: Click the Select tool. This is the cursor icon in the toolbar. You can also press S on your keyboard.

steps.title: Select both the shape and the image.
steps.content: Select both the shape and the image. Hold the Shift key, and then click the shape and image. This will select them at the same time.

steps.title: Click Object.
steps.content: Click Object . This is in the top toolbar, between Layer and Path .

steps.title: Select Clip, and then Set Clip.
steps.content: Select Clip , and then Set Clip . This will clip the image in the shape. If you have empty space around your image, you can crop the canvas. Click File > Document properties > Display > Resize to content .

steps.title: Open an image.
steps.content: Open an image. You can use the keyboard shortcut CTRL + I (Windows) or CMD + I (Mac) to import an image. You can also click File > Import .

steps.title: Select the drawing tool.
steps.content: Select the drawing tool. You can also select the drawing tool. This will have a pencil or pen as the icon, and you can find it in the toolbar.

steps.title: Draw your shape.
steps.content: Draw your shape. Use the drawing tool to freehand the shape in your image. You should be drawing around the part you want to keep.
